hackathon-description-text: HackCU hosts the largest collegiate hackathon in the Rocky Mountain region at the University of Colorado, Boulder. Every spring, we bring together people of all experience levels, majors and backgrounds to CU Boulder. HackCU provides the space and the resources for you to express your creativity, ingenuity, and determination to create anything you want to within 24 hours.
hackathon-eligibility: Any student 18 or older is welcome to participate.
hackathon-rules:

tl;dr - Don't be a jerk.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Philips Hue Bluetooth Custom Lights & Amazon Echo Dot
UE BOOM 2 speakers for each team member
The hack with the best use of MapQuest's API will land its team a Roll 2 Wireless, Bluetooth & Waterproof Speaker from Ultimate Ears.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Amazon Web Services
Best domain name registered with Domain.com

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!
Goal - Improve the connected motorcycle ride experience
Use Alteryx to decrypt a blob of text. Go to table to get the text.
Build something that promotes outdoor activities in Colorado.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Wolf Law Building, 2450 Kittredge Loop Dr, Boulder, CO 80305, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How technically impressive is the hack?
How intuitive is the user interface and experience?
How complete is the hack and was the team able to accomplish what they wanted to achieve?
How much did the team stretch themselves to learn something new?
